title: Welcome to Golz
p1: Golz is a small app designed to help users create SMART goals that are specific, measurable, attainable, relevant, and time-bound.
p2: The goals that users make are made up of outcome goals, that are in turn made of performance and process goals.
p3: This app uses MongoDB via Mongoose, Express, Node, and React with Typescript to allow users to create, read, update, and delete their goals.

title: Outcome Goals
p1: These types of goals are the most out of our control, and even if they are SMART our best efforts might not achieve them.
p2: Examples might include winning a baseball game, or being the best car salesperson in your company. Even if one does everything correct, the outcomes are not guaranteed.
p3: Therefore, just making outcome goals that are SMART is not enough, you should also make...

title: Performance Goals
p1: These goals, if achieved, are surely going to help you achieve your outcome goals. They must focus on a measurable component.
p2: If you want to win your baseball game, then increasing your batting average by 30% would surely help or increasing your sprint speed by half a mile per hour.
p3: These goals have an end date that they are achieved by but the daily goals that make them attainable are...

title: Process Goals
p1: These are the daily or weekly goals that guarantee performance goals, maybe they repeat, maybe they don't.
p2: To increase your batting average, your process goal might be to go to the batting cage three times per week for 60 minutes
p3: These goals don't need an explicit end date but accomplishing these little goals every week you can make grander visions happen.
